meanings.definition: A person who works only for pay, especially in a menial or boring job.
meanings.sent1: The hirelings cleaned the office every evening for a small wage.
meanings.sent2: The company hired several hirelings to help with the heavy lifting during the event.
meanings.sent3: The hirelings joked about their tedious tasks to make the day go by faster.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, hirelings are the unsung heroes behind the scenes.
meanings.sent5: The image of hirelings diligently sweeping the floors stayed with him long after he left the building.

meanings.definition: A person who is hired to do a particular job.
meanings.sent1: The hirelings arrived early to set up the stage for the concert.
meanings.sent2: The farmer needed extra hirelings to help with the harvest this season.
meanings.sent3: The hirelings celebrated completing their task with a small party.
meanings.sent4: The hirelings transformed the empty space into a bustling market in no time.
meanings.sent5: The hirelings' efficiency impressed everyone at the company.
